name: La Palma Princess & Teneguia Princess

reviews.text: Had a great all inc week with my wife and 15 yr son, he thought it was to quiet but selfish we were as we wanted a complete chill out relaxing week away and that's what we got. Food was great but make sure you have the late breakfast by the pools looking out to see " no dolphins for us though" spotlessly clean pool area and the whole site was spotless! Beware of the adult relax area as I thought it was just a child free area but NOPE it's a nudist area! Went for nice walks each day but I wouldn't recommend the walk to the lighthouse as the first hour of walking was like walking the back alleys of Manchester as it is all through the banana plantations of breeze block walls but if you do go watch out for the traffic as its all on road! Staff were nice room done every day to a high standard! I'm already looking to book another week without our youngest! All in all a great choice any bad reviews must be very picky
reviews.title: The best chill out venue but be sure you want to be away from it all!!
Mountains of fun
reviews.text: Had read previous reports before booking so booked a taxi instead of coach transfers which made the journey quicker and check in faster (taxi is €36 each way and we used La Palma Taxi who have a website for pre booking (www.taxilapalma.com). Gregorio has a 9 seater taxi and is a wealth of island information with great English.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Opted for sea view room at supplement of €175 which was worth the extra. Beautiful views in the morning and late afternoon sunshine on the balcony. Had a second floor room and a plug in mosquito so no bites or buzzing at night time. Air con was working all the time and beds were huge.
reviews.title: La Palma-Not again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took a travel kettle for coffee or tea which was a great idea. Didn't need the mosquito spray which previous reports mentioned.
reviews.title: It's ok.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes it is hilly but it's a good warm up for breakfast or dinner and there are lifts if you can't make the steps.
reviews.title: this is what makes november great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just had one week at the Princess and thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. Yes it is a bit out of the way but we knew that when we booked. We went all inclusive with Thomson, we were lucky enough to get their 1ppp offer so it made it excellent value for money. The food was very varied and a good choice of spirits and wine available, try the cappuccino.... The room was large and clean, the bathroom was fab, a huge walk in shower and a separate bath, cleaned every day with fresh towels too. Take your own beach towels though, 30 Euro deposit and if you want to change them there is a small charge. I can't really fault this hotel, the pools are fantastic and also cleaned every day.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We don't usually bother with the entertainment, but we did venture in and was very impressed by the acts, very varied and entertaining.
reviews.title: Lazy days!

reviews.text: Would like to say thank you to the reps Stacy and Lyndsey, it has been quite some time since I had a holiday where I was impressed by their professionalism and enthusiasm. They was a particular incident with another guest who seemed unable to control himself or his temper, I can honestly say that I thought they dealt with the situation very well and I for one was grateful for their actions and their honesty in the matter. These girls have to take a lot of stick over the course of the year - yes I know it is their job but there are something things that no-one can predict or control but they do an excellent job.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel but in the wrong location!
great island for walking
reviews.text: I would recommend hiring a car, these is a fantastic little island and very diverse. The holiday was a late booking for us so we had no knowledge of trips etc. We went to the meeting and booked our car through the rep and was given plenty of info to get us around the island. It is a must to go to the highest point Roque de la muchansos (think I have spelt it nearly right!!) and the rain forest is beautiful, take the LA109 and you will venture through some stunning scenery. We loved Puerto Naos, lovely little village on the beach with plenty of places to stop for a drink and a bite to eat. Would certainly recommend the hotel and this island.
We went for 1 week wanting a "get away from it all" break.
reviews.title: Research the Island and the Holiday complex before you book

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I chose La Palma and the hotel as a 'cheap' get away at the end of May, get some sunshine without breaking the bank! But we were amazed at what we got for our money! 11 swimming pools, so if you want to be 'away from kids' you can or you can have fun as a family.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantatic, looking to book for next year!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast: A choice of two buffets - one looking straight out into the open sea (where you can spot a whale if you are careful!)
reviews.title: Not a 5 star but 3 star

reviews.text: Lunch: Choice of immence buffet, pizzaria by the pool (serving pizza, burgers, snacks etc) or packed lunch if you are on a trip
reviews.title: Very chilled out

reviews.text: Dinner: Buffet, but choice of 4 hot food bars, two salad/cold food, lots of desserts and bread etc. Dinner was really good, lots to choose from and changed every night. Drinks are 'on tap' but its soft drinks, fruit juice, wine and beer - what more would you need?? There is also always chips, plain pasta and tomato sauce, so even the fussiest children could eat.
reviews.title: 2 week holiday at La Plama Princess

reviews.text: All inclusive - you obviously have all your food, then a separate all inclusive drinks menu which did us, but you could go for the other menu with a 50% discount for all inclusive. Yes you have to go to the bar to get your drinks, but you do at home too!
reviews.title: Relaxing Break

reviews.text: As all other reviews have stated this is a away from it all holiday due to its remote locaton, if you like going out to bars,shops and resturants this is not the holiday for you.
reviews.title: great hotel and service 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negative points first = 0
reviews.title: Beautiful Island - perfect hotel!

reviews.text: positive points>>>>>>
reviews.title: Fantastic all inclusive hotel ....but only for 7 days!!

reviews.text: Great hotel in stunning surrondings with yes 11 pools,ample sun beds and free pool towels to collect from spar.
reviews.title: Exceptional place to totally relax and unwind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Weather when we were there was great (17-08-09 for a week) sunny every day with little cloud and above 30+ every day.
reviews.title: Not for everyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was quick considering our flight was delayed and ended up clashing with the Manchester arrival. They kept the restaurant open for us &had porters take our bags to rooms to get us settled in quickly after late flight. Check out very quick. Safe €2 a day charged at end of stay. Pool towels are free with €30 fine if lost and a €0.50 charge for refresh towels during week.
reviews.title: Little slice of paradise

reviews.text: Internet is available wifi was €4 a day or €29 a week. Not sure how much computers were (cheaper). Books to borrow in reception too.
reviews.title: Wonderful little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Choose from 2 places for breakfast the main restaurant (Taburiente) or La Choza which is open until 10.30 & offers seating area looking over the sea. Plenty of choice in both, id recommend going to La Choza if you want a cooked breakfast as it's freshly cooked and although you have to wait longer you don't get bacon that's been sitting in oil for a while. The pancakes are delicious in both!
reviews.title: Peaceful paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can have lunch or snacks in pool bar between 11-6 they offer take away option which we thought was brilliant its nice to have a take away pizza to eat cold after a night in the bar! Loved the food in here a wide selection of pizzas, burgers, chips etc or the buffet lunch in main restaurant.
reviews.title: Fabulous Relaxing Week Away

reviews.text: Dinner is in the main restaurant upstairs, you can pay for a la carte restaurant next door on a Thurs evening if you fancy a change and all inclusive guest get 50% discount. We didn't try this so can't comment on what it's like. The food in the buffet restaurant' s lovely always something for everyone and nice hot food. Desserts delicious and plenty of choice. The juice machines on the all inclusive side are a nightmare either way to strong, weak or not working at all but the fizzy drinks one fine. My partner found it annoying that the coffee machines are not available to use in the evening in the restaurant. I didn't think the seating was an issue at all , yes all inclusive is separate to half board but I didn't find it degrading at all.
reviews.title: Excellent can not recommend this place enough

reviews.text: Stayed here for a week in January the weather was a balmy 23degrees. The rooms were spotless if a little dated in decor,but only a little. We felt like we were on a tropical island with the setting of palm trees all around. The hotel is away from most other attractions on the island which is why we chose it. It was perfect to sit back and be pampered by the staff. The entertainment was fun if you wanted to get involved or you could just relax. We will be returning.
reviews.title: Winter get away

reviews.text: We have just return from a great holiday in La Palma. The resort is huge with a beautiful landscaped pool area including a man made beach area. It really was gorgeous and although the hotel was busy you never felt crowded or needing to rush down at 7.00am to get a sun lounger. The room was spotlessly clean with a large bed, fridge and balcony. The all-inclusive package was good value with above average package holiday food and drinks (including cocktails). They still need to work on their 'service'. Whilst some (the ladies in the dining room) were excellent, others were just plain rude (pool bar). Also they do seems to treat all inclusive guests as second-class guests ( more uncomfortable chairs in the dining room, slower service at the bars). The spa on site was spectacular with a Hydro thermal circuit (a small E10 to try it!) would not be out of place at Champney or The Sanctuary.
reviews.title: Great value. Has a few quirks to work on but has huge potential.

reviews.text: We had a fantastic time and I would recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Perfect Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I`m not going to write about choice of food, pools, hotel, banana plantations etc as most people reading the reviews will already know what`s on offer.
reviews.title: So relaxing

reviews.text: However what I will write about is how well we were looked after during the 2 weeks we were there.
reviews.title: Hidden Heaven
TRAPPED and Climbing the walls
reviews.text: No we weren't trapped by the forrest fires. We stayed in this hotel a year ago, and I can only just bring myself to talk about the experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My expectations of Spanish holidays aren't great, noisy Northerners, children everywhere, and horrid buffet food! All that aside, a feeling of dred set in as i queued to check in. Noisy northerners - check, children - check. the sound of shuffing feet queueing to collect their tastless pasta dish from a large trough in the canteen.
reviews.title: brilliant, loved it, didn't want to leave

reviews.text: The rooms are situated in blocks, which are split by nationality. All the Germans are allocated rooms near the pools and main structure, where as the brits are allocated rooms on the periphal edge of the resort.
reviews.title: Go and enjoy!

reviews.text: The rooms themselves are fairly good sizes, but as another reviewer has mentioned, the flies are plentiful, so open the sliding door to your terrace at your peril!
reviews.title: Shame about the Fire!!!!

reviews.text: There is a small shop onsite whih provides a few home comforts but is very expensive.
reviews.title: Thank God We Survived!

reviews.text: Perhaps I have been spoilt at the other hotels and destinations that I have been to before but I didn't rate this as a great hotel.
reviews.title: Not bad, not brilliant, just ok

reviews.text: Rooms were nice and the maids did a good job cleaning every day. Staff were fairly helpful.
reviews.title: Fab holiday would go back any day!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, once we arrived, we were given our key and map and off we went. We, and 2 other couples could not find our rooms. The sign posts for our numbered rooms were wrong and lead us to another block where we thought our room had got lost in some sort of black hole!! It took us a good 30-45 minutes to find our room which was in a totally different direction to where it was meant to be.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food wasn't great. We were half board. I'm unsure whether to recommend going all inclusive or not. Everything is so expensive there that I would say yes. However, you don't get very good food so perhaps no! Main restaurant was ok. Same food every night plus we got charged huge amounts of money for 2 bottles of wine, when actually we only wanted a glass each and we also not informed that we could have taken the rest of the bottle with us that we didn't drink! Also offered 1 meal at a different restaurant which you had to book. It was awful. I'm guessing they just nipped over to the usual restaurant, filled our plates and came back with it again. I certainly do not recommend this.
reviews.title: Great Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the complex was nicely done. Pools and surrounding areas were very nice and because of the layout of the pools, it didn't seem overcrowded at all and fairly quiet. It was quite a climb to keep going up from the pool or rooms to the main reception/restaurant/entertainment area. Anyone who has trouble with walking etc then I probably wouldn't recommend this to.
reviews.title: Peace and Tranqulity

aka: La Palma Princess And Teneguia Princess
